‘Crypto Cloud Reset’: Putin Adviser Accuses US Of Plot To Erase $35 Trillion Debt

After 2-3 Years in Crypto… I Still Have Some Big Questions 
I’ve been in crypto for a couple of years now  long enough to ride through some highs and lows, try out different chains, test a few DeFi protocols, and watch a lot of projects come and go. But even after spending a good amount of time here, I still find myself wondering about a few things, and I’d love to hear what others in the space think.

Here are a few questions I’ve been thinking about:

What are we actually waiting for to push crypto into “everyday use”  is it regulation, UX, scalability, or just time?

Do most people really want decentralization, or do they just want better financial access?

Are L2s and alt L1s genuinely competing long-term, or are we going to consolidate around one main ecosystem eventually?

Is there any realistic chance that crypto becomes boring and just “part of the internet,” or will it always be kind of fringe and volatile?

What use cases are you actually excited about right now beyond trading and speculation?


Just honestly curious what others in the community think   especially those who’ve been here longer or have seen earlier cycles.

Would love to hear your perspective guys!
Algorand Foundation Releases Aid Trust Portal To Track and Visualize Humanitarian Aid Payments - Decrypt

Solana’s Growing Ecosystem , Faster, Cheaper, and Getting More Versatile or another hype ? Hey everyone, 
Just been following Solana a bit more closely lately  it feels like the network has been quietly improving in the background. Fewer outages than before, fast and super low-cost transactions, and a noticeable uptick in developer activity. It seems like more serious infrastructure is starting to emerge alongside the usual NFT and DeFi projects.


One thing I’ve noticed is that Solana’s ecosystem is expanding into areas like oracles, storage, and randomness  tools that help make dApps more powerful. Projects like Switchboard have been popping up to fill these roles, offering things like customizable data feeds or on chain randomness. There are others too, but it’s interesting to see how the ecosystem is trying to cover more of the stack, rather than just relying on Ethereum native solutions.


Just seeing more diversity in the types of tools available for devs building on Solana, which feels like a healthy sign for the long term.


On the cex side, platforms like bitget have been listing more Solana-based tokens too, which might reflect some broader confidence in the chain's growth. Whether that’s just trend chasing or something deeper, time will tell

Anyone else building on Solana or tracking how it's evolving? Curious what you're seeing in terms of tooling or infrastructure that’s actually helpful.

I’ve been in crypto for a couple of years now  long enough to ride through some highs and lows, try out different chains, test a few DeFi protocols, and watch a lot of projects come and go. But even after spending a good amount of time here, I still find myself wondering about a few things, and I’d love to hear what others in the space think.

Here are a few questions I’ve been thinking about:

What are we actually waiting for to push crypto into “everyday use”  is it regulation, UX, scalability, or just time?

Do most people really want decentralization, or do they just want better financial access?

Are L2s and alt L1s genuinely competing long-term, or are we going to consolidate around one main ecosystem eventually?

Is there any realistic chance that crypto becomes boring and just “part of the internet,” or will it always be kind of fringe and volatile?

Just honestly curious what others in the community think   especially those who’ve been here longer or have seen earlier cycles.
